visualization_explanation: The dataset represents a proportional composition visualization with six categorical layers of Earth's atmosphere. Each series uses equal numerical values (1 unit) to enable percentage stacking, with synthetic metadata (height ranges and informational tooltips) providing contextual meaning. The synthetic data maintains domain validity through NASA-derived layer height ranges and temperature characteristics. The column chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating axes and gridlines while maintaining perceptual transparency through color progression from light (upper atmosphere) to dark (lower atmosphere). Proportional stacking enables immediate visual comparison of relative layer thicknesses. Tooltips apply Cairo's principle of informative interaction by revealing layer-specific physics and biological relevance. Color choices follow Tufte's minimal contrast principle while maintaining categorical distinction.
